meanings.definition: Not calm or tranquil; restless or uneasy.
meanings.sent1: The stormy weather made the ocean inquiet and turbulent.
meanings.sent2: The inquiet child fidgeted in his seat during the boring lecture.
meanings.sent3: The inquiet puppy kept running around the house, unable to sit still.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat inquietly as she waited for the exam results.
meanings.sent5: The inquiet wind rustled the leaves, creating a sense of unease in the forest.

meanings.definition: To disturb or agitate; make uneasy.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site inquieted the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The mysterious sound in the dark inquieted the children camping in the woods.
meanings.sent3: The prankster enjoyed inquieting his friends with unexpected scares.
meanings.sent4: The unsettling news inquieted the entire community.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the haunted house inquieted the brave explorers.

meanings.definition: A state of restlessness or unease.
meanings.sent1: The inquiet in the waiting room was palpable as everyone awaited the results.
meanings.sent2: The sudden change in plans caused an inquiet among the group.
meanings.sent3: The inquiet of the restless crowd grew as they waited for the show to start.
meanings.sent4: The uncertainty of the future brought an inquiet to her mind.
meanings.sent5: The inquiet in the air hinted at an approaching storm.
